content:
It sounds like you have a clear idea for the overall plot of your book and the themes that you want to explore. It can be helpful to brainstorm and create a detailed outline of the events and character arcs that will take place within the timeline of the story. This can help you to better understand how the different elements of the plot fit together and how to effectively reveal information to the reader.

In addition to the main plot points that you've described, you might also want to consider the following elements as you continue to develop your story:

* Character development: How do the characters change and grow over the course of the story? What challenges do they face and how do they overcome them?
* Setting: How do the technological and societal advancements of the future impact the world in which the characters live? How do the characters interact with their environment and how does it shape their experiences and perspectives?
* Conflict: What conflicts or challenges arise for the characters as a result of the events of the story? How do they work to resolve these conflicts and what obstacles do they face along the way?

I hope these suggestions are helpful as you continue to plan and write your book. Please don't hesitate to ask if you have any other questions or need further guidance.
